history.content:
HI there,


This has not been an issue before and so the answer does not yet exist. A student would need to present a request to the Vice Chair of Undergraduate Matters, and they would likely approve/deny. This would not be done by tonight's deadline.

@Emerald Templeton  @Lily Zhang : Any other thoughts?

children.subject:
Hi,

That is correct. This sort of request would need to be approved by the Vice Chair of Undergraduate Matters. CS 199 will not replace DS 100; students will receive units by taking CS 199 for P/NP but those units will not count towards upper-division requirements, nor their degree.

history.content:
Hi,

I'm waitlisted for DS 100, which counts as a CS upper div, and got this message from the instructor.

My question is, if we take this class as CS 199, is there any way for it to still count as an upper div for the major? From the CS page I read "Note: All courses taken for the major must be at least 3 units and taken for a letter grade. " However, if at the end of the semester, I had the instructor write a letter stating I took the class and my grade in it, is this possible?

I'm sorry that this is so close to the drop deadline, but we got this message today. I'm also a last semester senior so there's no chance I can take this class later.
history.subject: DS100 Upper Div Credit?
